channel.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK
channel.description:
[url]https://store.steampowered.com/app/630/[/url]
I wonder if this means BM will be "free free" as opposed to just "free"
What do you think?

item.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
Raminator:

So you’re basically just pointing out your lack of imagination for shits and giggles?

Nope, just pointing out Valve’s surplus of it.

Read full topic

item.source: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK

item.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK
item.dc:creator: Grey_Acumen
item.description:
It’ll be pretty easy to figure out. I have an account that only has the free portal giveaway that DOESN’T have the Source SDK included, and as a result can’t play Portal: Prelude or Aperture Deja Vu. It might require modifying the gameinfo.txt file for those mods.
I don’t see how they could possibly create a SDK Base that was alien swarm exclusive, especially if the mod that you’d be trying to run on it uses completely custom code and resources, though in the case of Black Mesa, they said that a few things, like the Barnacles and Headcrabs weren’t custom created, so if those creatures weren’t included in the Alien Swarm Source Base, then Black Mesa probably wouldn’t run properly.

Read full topic
item.source: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK

item.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK

item.description:
the whole Alien Swarm thing is just a gag to cover up a huge TF2 update to accompany the polycount items.

item.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK
item.dc:creator: Sanji
item.description:
I think its the same as the authoring tools from Left 4 Dead 1 and 2. It just contains the Hammer Editor and some modeling tools and no source code for creating “real” mods.

But we will see soon

Read full topic
item.source: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK

item.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK
item.dc:creator: Medevilae
item.description:
dannydork:

Valve Developer Jonathan: “It’s a separate SDK.”

Just in case you were too lazy to click the link above.

This, basically.

Think of it as HL2 : DM (except awesome,) but the provide you with the tools to make things for the game. This qualifies as an “SDK,” although it is not the SDK for Source; it’s the SDK for Alien Swarm. (game specific developer kit.)

EDIT:

Strike that- Johnathan meant it contains an SDK for Alien Swarm (It comes with it’s own stuff; like a “tile based map development tool”). However, according to the Steam page, it includes the Source SDK as well.

“Includes Source SDK”

EDIT:EDIT: It’s the Source SDK locked into Alien Swarm. You will not be able to run mods like Black Mesa on it. (Unless Black Mesa becomes an Alien-Swarm mod.)

Read full topic
item.source: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK

item.dc:creator: Denton
item.description:
It’s just the SDK for Alien Swarm.

Evidence: https://forums.steampowered.com/forums/showthread.php?p=16106943

It seems another source powered game will still be required for BMS unless there’s some misunderstanding in that thread.

item.title: So, Valve's new Free Game contains Source SDK
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
It would seem so.

The more important question is: does the update of the SDK affect the development of BM in any way? Or any other finished mods.

[EDIT]

Alien Swarm is a[COLOR=‘gray’] game and Source SDK release […]
Along with the game get the complete code base for Alien Swarm that features updates to the Source engine as well as the SDK
